verses.roman:
ebe tumi śāntā haile, āsi, mililāṅ
bhāgya mora,--tomā hena atithi pāilāṅ

synonyms: ebe—now; tumi—You; śānta—pacified; haile—have become; āsi'-coming; mililāṅ—I have met (You); bhāgya mora—it is my great fortune; toma—You; hena—like; atithi—guest; pāilāṅ—I have received.
translation: "Now that You have become pacified, I have come to You. It is my good fortune to receive a guest like Your Honor.
